E89109023F4A4B0D879586A91E8A428C.description:
Draw evidence from informational texts
to support analysis, reflection, and research.

838DC7C808E94AB3AF36130E9AD7EACD.description:
Gather relevant information from
multiple sources, using search terms effectively;
annotate sources; assess the credibility and
accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase
the data and conclusions of others while avoiding
plagiarism and following a standard format for
citation (e.g., APA or Chicago).

29027AB6E3CC4FDDA3F1A3F2D4C5DF48.description:
Conduct short research assignments
and tasks to answer a question (including a selfgenerated
question), drawing on several sources
and generating additional related, focused
questions that allow for multiple avenues of
exploration.

3D910BC70E3C42C28A08E0A8E263226A.description: Build knowledge about the research process and the topic under study by conducting short or more sustained research

F40D3A3764684BCCB40220EFE4778180.description:
Use technology to produce and publish
writing and present the relationships between
information and ideas clearly and efficiently.

CD54D774ED924024AF495CAF096FE451.description:
Plan and develop; draft; revise using
appropriate reference materials; rewrite; try a new
approach; and edit to produce and strengthen
writing that is clear and coherent, with some
guidance and support from peers and adults.

E5FF6AB76DDA4B11B72F45142C9D2A6A.description: Produce coherent and legible documents by planning, drafting, revising, editing, and collaborating with others

5A8B99BDF7FE45A0B0406C605C91E35D.description:
Write informative texts, including
analyses of historical events.

EBB0C7A9510A464FBEBCAEA3DCF5E970.description:
Write arguments focused on discipline-specific
content.

EB44224A350C44DBB385F73607F396AF.description: Write for different purposes and to specific audiences or people

00DF3C3855D04100BD783B72D0E962B5.description:
Compare and contrast treatments of
the same topic in a primary and secondary source.

81BFC50B7BD14959B01DA3807C736C6A.description:
Distinguish among fact, opinion, and
reasoned judgment in a text.

42F106C3A950448CA896E24E62B7B196.description:
Integrate visual information (e.g.,
charts, graphs, photographs, videos, or maps) with
other information in print and digital texts.

4C08B01DA6924961ADA664D9A3CDD37E.description: Build understanding of history/social studies texts by synthesizing and connecting ideas and evaluating specific claims

564A06A364C942C382659F39734EF394.description:
Identify aspects of a text that reveal an
author’s perspective or purpose (e.g., loaded
language, inclusion or avoidance of particular
facts).

B1C9FDD263844368B42B811645699518.description:
Describe how a text presents
information (e.g., sequentially, comparatively,
causally).

AF8B31CB6264445E9F1EC881A28DA4F1.description:
Determine the meaning of words and
phrases as they are used in a text, including
vocabulary specific to domains related to
history/social studies.

E57BA5B6C27A44F187E74B6155A27EE7.description: Build understanding of history/social studies texts, using knowledge of structural organization and author’s purpose and message

3C3F5B65915248C68FFDB4366931ADD2.description:
Identify key steps in a text’s description
of a process related to history/social studies (e.g.,
how a bill becomes a law, how interest rates are
raised or lowered).

7C22FABAD6C94DC191044A740A7D7AD9.description:
Determine the central ideas or
information of a primary or secondary source;
provide an accurate summary of the source distinct
from prior knowledge or opinions.

12988047D31B40208B97A7D1109F362E.description:
Cite specific textual evidence to
support analysis of primary and secondary sources

D1A7AD519C5B4B58B7641EAD7FA161EC.description: Extract and construct meaning from history/social studies texts using a variety of comprehension skills

3BEB7747FFCD4FA19AC5AFDB625B6855.description:
Write routinely over a variety of time
frames for a range of discipline-specific tasks,
purposes, and audiences.

F7F005FCCEF643AEB40D9391A356E3A5.description:
Read and comprehend history/social
studies texts within a range of complexity
appropriate for grades 6-8 independently and
proficiently by the end of grade 8

92A74953E1904D0DBCCD1EAD28AB9B30.description:
Read and comprehend history/social studies texts independently and proficiently,
and write effectively for a variety of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences
